description: After updating to Microsoft Edge version 130.0.2849.68, users may experience unexpected crashes when interacting with web pages that utilize the affected Chromium framework. This behavior can result in data loss, as unsaved work may be lost when the application closes unexpectedly. Additionally, users may notice browser instability, characterized by frequent error messages related to memory access violations. The root cause of these issues relates to a security vulnerability documented under CVE-2024-10487. The update serves to mitigate risks associated with out-of-bounds memory access, yet the transitional phase during which users adopt the latest release may lead to increased occurrences of these errors, diminishing the application’s reliability. System administrators are encouraged to monitor user feedback post-update for signs of recurring crashes, as they could indicate a need for further patch updates or configurations to stabilize the environment.
